translation: The monks and nuns said, "I will save you if you give me your bowl; I will save you from leaving home if you give me your robe, your door hook, your seasonal medicine, your seven-day medicine, and your full-form medicine."

source_sentence: 居士婦言：「汝等客作度人耶？」
translation: The householder woman said, "Are you guests trying to save someone?"

source_sentence: 是比丘尼言：「爾。」
translation: The monks and nuns said, "So it is."

source_sentence: 他日諸善比丘尼，至是居士舍，居士婦問言：「汝等實客作度人耶？」
translation: Some other day, when the good monks and nuns arrived at the house of that householder, the householder's wife asked, "Are you really guests who have set out to save others?"

source_sentence: 善比丘尼言：「誰作是語？」
translation: The good monks and nuns said, "Who says that?"

source_sentence: 居士婦言：「我語助調達比丘尼：『汝當度我出家。』
translation: The householder woman said, "I said to the assistant director of the monks and nuns, 'You will grant me leave from home.'

source_sentence: 便語我言：『與我鉢來，我當度汝；與我衣、戶鉤、時藥、時分藥、七日藥、盡形藥，我當度汝。』」
translation: She then said to me, 'Give me my bowl and I will save you; give me my robe, door hook, seasonal medicine, seven-day medicine, and full-form medicine, and I will save you.'"

source_sentence: 是中有比丘尼，少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜呵責言：「云何名比丘尼，作是言：『汝與我鉢、與我衣、戶鉤、時藥、時分藥、七日藥、盡形藥，我當度汝？』」
translation: One of those nuns, a practitioner of the ascetic practice of having few desires and being satisfied, heard this and was displeased and rebuked, "What's the name of a nun who says, 'Give me your bowl, give me your robe, your door hook, your seasonal medicine, your hourly medicine, your seven-day medicine, and your full-form medicine, and I will save you?'"

source_sentence: 種種因緣呵已，向佛廣說。
translation: After he had been told about the various causes and conditions, he explained them in detail to the Buddha.

translation: Knowing this, the Buddha gathered the two groups of monks together and therefore asked the assistant director of the monks, "Is this really what you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實作。

translation: The Buddha rebuked them for various reasons, "What's the name of a monk and nun who says, 'Bring me a bowl and robe, a door hook, seasonal medicine, seven-day medicine, and full-form medicine, and I will save you.'"

source_sentence: 佛種種因緣呵已，語諸比丘：「以十利故與比丘尼結戒。
translation: After the Buddha had spoken to them for various reasons, he said to the monks, "It's because of the ten benefits that I've bound the monks and nuns to the precepts.

source_sentence: 從今是戒應如是說：若比丘尼作是言：『若汝與我鉢衣、戶鉤、時藥、時分藥、七日藥、盡形藥，我當度汝。』
translation: From now on, this precept should be explained like this: 'If a monk or nun says this, 'If you give me a bowl, a door hook, medicines for the seasons, medicines for the divisions of time, medicines for seven days, and medicines for my whole form, I will save you.'

source_sentence: 波夜提。」

source_sentence: 波夜提者，燒煮覆障，若不悔過，能障礙道。
translation: A "pāyattika" is a boiling hindrance that, if not repented of, can obstruct the path.

source_sentence: 是中犯者，若比丘尼作是言：「汝與我鉢衣、戶鉤、時藥、時分藥、七日藥、盡形藥，我當度汝。」
translation: If this is the offense, then if a monk or nun says, "Give me your bowl and robe, your door hook, your seasonal medicine, your seven-day medicine, and your full-form medicine, and I will save you."

source_sentence: 皆波夜提。
translation: They're all pāyattied.

source_sentence: 隨作是語，隨得波夜提。
translation: Whatever you say, you'll attain pāyattika.

translation: (One hundred and twenty-three things)

source_sentence: 佛在舍衛國。
translation: The Buddha was in the country of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時舍衛國，居士有婦不隨夫教，以手脚打驅出自舍。
translation: At the time, there was a woman living in Śrāvastī who didn't follow her husband's instructions and beat her with her hands and feet to drive her out of the house.

source_sentence: 有比丘尼常入出是家，婦往至比丘尼所。
translation: A bhikṣuṇī used to enter and leave that house, and the woman went to the bhikṣuṇī.

source_sentence: 是居士到餘聚落，作是念：「我婦將無走去耶？」
translation: When that householder went to another village, he thought, "Will my wife ever leave?"

source_sentence: 還舍覓不得，居士念言：「我婦必往至比丘尼精舍。」
translation: When he couldn't find his way back to the monastery, the householder thought, "My wife will surely go to the monks' and nuns' quarters."

source_sentence: 居士復作是念：「置使在彼令好調伏，後當將還。」
translation: The monk then thought, "Suppose she's kept there, so that she'll be well disciplined, and then she'll return."

source_sentence: 是婦五六日住已，語所知識比丘尼：「善女！
translation: After she stayed there for five or six days, that woman said to the well-known monk and nun, "Good girl!

source_sentence: 何不度我？」
translation: Why won't you save me?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝婿尚在，云何度汝？」
translation: He replied, "How could your son-in-law, who is still here, save you?"

source_sentence: 婦言：「夫不用我，若須我者，應當自來，亦當遣使。」
translation: The woman said, "My husband doesn't need me; if he needed me, he would come himself or send an envoy."

source_sentence: 比丘尼即度令出家。
translation: The monk and nun then ordered her to leave home.

source_sentence: 是居士聞婦出家，瞋恚語婦師言：「汝惡比丘尼、賊比丘尼，汝破我家。」
translation: When that monk heard that the woman had left home, he spoke angrily to the woman's teacher, saying, "You bad monk and nun, thief monk and nun, you've destroyed my house."

source_sentence: 「何故破汝家？」
translation: "Why have you destroyed your house?"

source_sentence: 答言：「奪我婦作比丘尼。」
translation: He replied, "Take my wife and make her a monk's nun."

source_sentence: 比丘尼言：「此是汝婦，汝便將去。」
translation: The monks and nuns said, "This is your wife, so you'll go away."

source_sentence: 諸居士呵責言：「諸比丘尼自言：『善好有功德。』
translation: The monks rebuked them, saying, "Those bhikṣuṇīs say to themselves, 'Good, nice, and meritorious!'

source_sentence: 主不聽便度他婦，如王夫人、大臣婦。」
translation: When the lord doesn't listen, he gives refuge to another woman, like a king's wife or a minister's wife."

source_sentence: 是中有比丘尼，少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，種種因緣呵責言：「云何名比丘尼，主不聽便度他婦？」
translation: One of those monks and nuns who was practicing the ascetic practice of having few desires and being satisfied was displeased when he heard this, and he was rebuked for various reasons, saying, "What do you call a monk and nun who surrenders other wives without listening to the lord?"

source_sentence: 種種因緣呵已，向佛廣說。
translation: After he had been told about the various causes and conditions, he explained them in detail to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集二部僧，知而故問是比丘尼：「汝實作是事不？」
translation: The Buddha gathered the two groups of monks together because of this, and knowing this, he asked the monks and nuns, "Is this really what you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實作。
translation: He replied, "It's really done.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛以種種因緣呵責：「云何名比丘尼，主不聽便畜為眾？」
translation: The Buddha rebuked them for various reasons, "What is the name of a nun who is a bhikṣu and whose master doesn't listen and then takes him into his congregation?"

source_sentence: 種種因緣呵責已，語諸比丘：「以十利故與比丘尼結戒。
translation: After he had been rebuked for various reasons, he told the monks, "It's because of the ten benefits that he bound the monks and nuns to the precepts.

source_sentence: 從今是戒應如是說：若比丘尼，女人主不聽，畜為眾者，波夜提。」
translation: From now on, this precept should be explained like this: 'If a monk or nun whose wife's master doesn't listen to her and she's a member of her community, then it's Pāṇḍarī.'

source_sentence: 主不聽者，有三種：若未嫁女；父母不聽；若已嫁未至夫家者，爾時兩邊不聽，若已至夫家，夫主不聽，波夜提。
translation: There are three kinds of people whose masters won't listen: if a woman is unmarried, her parents won't listen; if she's married and hasn't yet arrived at her husband's house, then both sides won't listen; and if she's arrived at her husband's house and her husband's master doesn't listen, then it's pāyattika.

source_sentence: 波夜提者，燒煮覆障，若不悔過，能障礙道。
translation: A pāyattika is a boiling hindrance that, if not repented of, can obstruct the path.

source_sentence: 是中犯者，若比丘尼，夫主不聽便度，波夜提。
translation: If this is the offense, then if a monk or nun is rejected by her husband's master without listening, then he'll be saved, pāyattika.

source_sentence: 隨不聽度，隨得波夜提。
translation: As long as he doesn't listen, he'll be granted pāyattika.

source_sentence: (一百二百四事竟)佛在王舍城。
translation: (After 124 events) The Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時助調達比丘尼，有大式叉摩尼，可受大戒。
translation: At the time, there was a great prātimokṣaṇi who was an assistant to the disciplined monks and nuns and who could receive the great precepts.

source_sentence: 施越沙比丘尼，見是大式叉摩尼，即便語言：「汝何不受大戒？」
translation: When the monks and nuns of Śiviṣya saw this great Śikṣamāṇā, they even said, "Why don't you accept the great precepts?"

source_sentence: 答言：「助調達比丘尼兇惡喜鬪，我不欲從彼受大戒。
translation: He replied, "An assistant-discipline nun is fierce and likes to fight, and I don't want to receive the great precepts from him.

source_sentence: 汝若與我作和上尼者，我當受大戒。」
translation: If you become a superior nun with me, I will accept the great precepts."

source_sentence: 施越沙言：「汝二歲學六法，我當畜汝為眾。」
translation: Svabhūṣa said, "If you train in the six dharmas at two years old, I will take you as a member of my congregation."

source_sentence: 是大式叉摩尼二歲學六法已，語施越沙言：「汝語我：『二歲學六法，我當畜汝為眾。』
translation: After he had studied the six dharmas for two years, the great Śikṣamāṇi said to Śivi, "You said to me, 'Study the six dharmas for two years, and I will corral you into my congregation.'

source_sentence: 我已二歲學六法，汝當畜我。」
translation: I've been training the six dharmas for two years, so you will corral me."

source_sentence: 施越沙言：「我不畜汝。
translation: Śiviṣṭha said, "I won't be able to corral you.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是助調達比丘尼兇惡喜鬪諍，自能傷他、亦能教人作，以是故我不畜汝。」
translation: This assistant-discipline monk and nun is fierce, likes to fight, and can harm others and teach others to do so; therefore, I won't corral you."

source_sentence: 又言：「汝若不能畜我，何以語我二歲學六法？
translation: They also said, "If you can't bind me, why did you say that I would train in the six dharmas for two years?

source_sentence: 若汝先不語我者，我不二歲學六法。」
translation: If you hadn't said anything to me, I wouldn't have trained in the six dharmas for two years."

source_sentence: 是中有比丘尼，少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事種種因緣呵責言：「云何名比丘尼，語他言：『汝二歲學六法，我當畜汝。』
translation: One of those nuns, a practitioner of asceticism with few desires and fulfillment, heard about this and various other causes and rebuked him, "What's the name of a nun who says to others, 'You were two years old when you learned the six dharmas, and I will store you.'

source_sentence: 後便不畜？」
translation: Won't you be reared later?"

source_sentence: 種種因緣呵已，向佛廣說。
translation: After he had been told about the various causes and conditions, he explained them in detail to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集二部僧，知而故問是比丘尼：「汝實作是事不？」
translation: The Buddha gathered the two groups of monks together because of this, and knowing this, he asked the monks and nuns, "Is this really what you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實作。
translation: He replied, "It's really done.

translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛以種種因緣呵責言：「云何名比丘尼，語他言：『汝二歲學六法，我當畜汝。』
translation: The Buddha rebuked them for various reasons, saying, "What's the name of a nun who says to others, 'You were two years old when you studied the six dharmas, and I will keep you.'

source_sentence: 後便不畜？」
translation: Will you not be reared later?"

source_sentence: 種種因緣呵已，語諸比丘：「以十利故與諸比丘尼結戒。
translation: After he had been told about various causes and conditions, he said to the monks, "It's for the sake of the ten benefits that I've bound the monks and nuns to the precepts.

source_sentence: 從今是戒應如是說：若比丘尼語他言：『汝二歲學六法，後當畜汝。』
translation: From now on, this precept should be explained like this: 'If a monk or nun says to another, 'You were two years old when you studied the six dharmas, you'll be reared later.'

source_sentence: 若不畜者，波夜提。」
translation: If you don't, you'll be reared, pāyattika."

source_sentence: 波夜提者，燒煮覆障，若不悔過，能障礙道。
translation: A "pāyattika" is a boiling hindrance that, if not repented of, can obstruct the path.

source_sentence: 是中犯者，若比丘尼語他言：「汝二歲學六法，我當畜汝。」
translation: If a monk or nun in such a situation violates it, he or she says to the other monk or nun, "You were two years old when you learned the six dharmas, and I will store them for you."

source_sentence: 後便不畜者，波夜提。
translation: Whoever doesn't keep them afterward, that's Pāyānti.

source_sentence: 隨不畜，隨得波夜提。
translation: Whatever you don't keep, you'll attain pāyattika.

source_sentence: (一百二十五事竟)佛在舍衛國。
translation: (After one hundred and twenty-five events) The Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時偷蘭難陀比丘尼，歲歲度弟子，語諸弟子言：「我所入處，汝等皆隨我入。
translation: It was then that the monks and nuns of Nandana addressed their disciples year by year, saying, "Where I enter, you all follow me in.

source_sentence: 若我有所得者，汝亦當得。」
translation: If there's anything I can get, you will get it, too."

source_sentence: 偷蘭難陀比丘尼，一時著衣持鉢行乞食，入一家得滿鉢去。
translation: One time, the monks and nuns of Pūraṇṇḍa went begging for food while wearing robes and carrying a bowl, and they entered one house and got their bowls filled.

source_sentence: 次弟子入，又得滿鉢去。
translation: The next disciple entered, and he again got his bowl filled.

source_sentence: 第二、第三亦復次入。
translation: The second and third entered in turn.

source_sentence: 居士不能復與，即閉門作是言：「誰能與是諸不吉比丘尼食？」
translation: Unable to give them back, the monk closed his door and said, "Who can give these unlucky monks and nuns food?"

source_sentence: 是中有比丘尼，少欲知足行頭陀，聞是事心不喜，向佛廣說。
translation: One of those nuns, a practitioner of asceticism with few desires and fulfillment, heard about this and wasn't pleased at heart, so he explained it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集二部僧，知而故問：「汝實作是事不？」
translation: The Buddha gathered the two groups of monks together because of this fact, and knowing it, he asked, "Is this really what you do?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實作。
translation: He replied, "It's really done.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛以種種因緣呵責偷蘭難陀比丘尼：「云何名比丘尼，歲歲度弟子？」
translation: The Buddha rebuked the monks and nuns of Nandana for various reasons, "What is the name of a monk and nun who tries to disciple someone every year?"

source_sentence: 種種因緣呵已，語諸比丘：「以十利故與比丘尼結戒。
translation: After he had been told about various causes and conditions, he said to the monks, "It's for the sake of the ten benefits that I've bound the monks and nuns to the precepts.

source_sentence: 從今是戒應如是說：若比丘尼歲歲度弟子者，波夜提。」
translation: From now on, this precept should be explained like this: 'If a monk or nun makes a disciple every year, that's a pāyattika.'

source_sentence: 波夜提者，燒煮覆障，若不悔過，能障礙道。
translation: A pāyattika is a boiling hindrance that, if not repented of, can obstruct the path.

source_sentence: 是中犯者，若比丘尼歲歲度弟子者，波夜提。
translation: If this is a violation, then if a monk or nun rewards his disciple with years and years, that's a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 隨歲歲度，隨得波夜提。
translation: Following the passing of a year, he'll receive a pāyattika.

source_sentence: 不犯者，若隔歲度一、若度二者，不犯。
translation: If someone doesn't violate it, then if they redeem one or two disciples every other year, they won't violate it.

source_sentence: (一百二十六事竟)◎◎比丘尼壇文佛在舍衛國。
translation: (After One Hundred and Twenty-six Acts)◎◎ The Discipline of Nuns was in the country of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時有迦毘羅女作比丘尼名跋陀，有式叉摩尼可受大戒。
translation: At the time, there was a Kapila woman who became a bhikṣuṇī named Bhadra, and there were Śikṣamāṇīs who could receive the great precepts.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難常為比丘尼差十比丘眾，與受大戒。
translation: It was then that Ānanda often sent a group of ten monks to the bhikṣuṇīs to receive the great precepts.

source_sentence: 時阿難中前著衣持鉢入舍衛城乞食，跋陀比丘尼遙見阿難舍衛城乞食，往到其所，頭面禮足一面住，白言：「大德阿難！
translation: When Ānanda entered Śrāvastī with his robe and bowl to solicit alms, the monk nun Bhadra saw Ānanda going to solicit alms in Śrāvastī from a distance, went to him, bowed his head at his feet, and stood to one side, saying, "Mañjuśrī Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我有式叉摩尼可受大戒，願差十比丘眾。」
translation: I have a monk or nun who can receive the great precepts and would like to send a group of 10 monks."

source_sentence: 阿難問言：「比丘尼僧作乞屬和上尼羯磨未？」
translation: Ānanda asked, "Have the monks and nuns made a request for subordinate and superior nuns to perform the kalpa?"

source_sentence: 答言：「已作。」
translation: He replied, "It's been done."

source_sentence: 「何時作耶？」
translation: "When will it be done?"

source_sentence: 答言：「昨日作。」
translation: He replied, "He did it yesterday."

source_sentence: 阿難即默然受。
translation: Ānanda then accepted it in silence.

source_sentence: 跋陀比丘尼知阿難受已，頭面禮足而去。
translation: Knowing that Ānanda had accepted it, the Bhadrapāla nuns bowed their heads and feet and departed.

source_sentence: 阿難乞食食已到祇洹，持戶鉤遊行，從一房至一房。
translation: After begging for food and arriving at Jetavana, Ānanda carried a household hook and marched from room to room.

source_sentence: 佛遙見阿難持戶鉤從房至房遊行，佛知故問阿難：「汝何故持戶鉤遊行從房至房？」
translation: The Buddha saw Ānanda from a distance, marching from room to room with his monk's hook. Knowing this, the Buddha asked Ānanda, "Why are you marching from room to room with your monk's hook?"

source_sentence: 阿難白言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 跋陀比丘尼有式叉摩尼可受大戒，語我差十比丘眾。
translation: The Bhadrapāla bhikṣuṇīs had a prayer that Sīkṣamāṇī would receive the great precepts, and they told me to send them to a group of ten monks.
